Now I know reading this, you probably might think, "big deal, she gave you a lunchable!"  In life the small things mean the most to me and the fact that she wanted to let me try this as she finished, without asking me, meant a lot to me.  

Add in the fact that this place, like most places nowadays, has a self checkout, I'd say this grocery store is top knotch!  The food may not be top grade like a Whole Foods, but the service I got today was 2nd to none!

There are certainly things you could dislike about this Smith's, such as the location, the always-packed parking lot, and how busy it gets. To me, however, this Smith's is a 4-star grocery store.

I find this Smith's offer a nice balance between the unbearable Walmart experience, and the high prices at Vons. Sure, it's usually busy here, but at least this location typically has ample checkers on hand. The lines generally move faster here than at Walmart or Vons, which is also a big plus.

In short, Smith's offers good prices, a relatively clean interior, and fast check-out lines. 

A recent remodel has improved the aesthetics inside considerably, although there is nothing they can do about the surrounding neighborhood.

I've been so disappointed with all the Smith's here in Las Vegas/Henderson. I always stop by to cash my check, sometimes it works out but more often than not customer service is on break,  or they're not open.....at 9am, they aren't open. Absolutely ridiculous. I always intend to shop once I've cashed my check but 9/10 I have to take my check and shop, elsewhere. This consistently happens at the 3 Smith's near me. I keep going thinking it'll be different,  but I give up. I miss shopping at Smith's ( Dillions) in kansas, it's just a huge let down here.

I always buy my groceries here instead of walmart, haggens, Albertsons etc
They always have something on sale and its less crowded than walmart. They have a variety of fresh veggies and fruits. The bakery always makes fresh donuts aaaand fresh backed french bread. Don't go on the first day of the month, those are their packed days. 
Wed and thurs they have their meats on sale
Also gatorades are on sale for 69 cents...that's a good a$$ deal to me so stock up if you see them on sale. Then they'll raise the price to $1  each.
Use your free smiths card  to get shoppers discount. 
On special months they give out free samples or give you a free product when signing up for their credit card. 
You also get feul points, every dollar you spend they put points in your card for free or cheaper gas at their gas station or shell gas station.

Between the time of 10pm-11:30pm the evening staff are not helpful. 
One particular attendant was veey unprofessional the way she acted when a customer needed help. 
Her description is a light skinned black girl that wears a neon vest. When (I) the customer needed help she just stood there by the screen rolling her eyes making attitude faces like she don't want to be bothered. Very lazy employee need to be fired. 
A pregnant lady was walking to the atm and she didn't move to the other side to give space for the pregnant lady to get to the atm. 
Evening staffs at this Smith store are not well-trained to deal with error transactions especially when dealing with cash back. One would say cashback available to $100, then later on same employee will say no cashback we can't do it. I can't help you. 

I am not going back to this store. Very disappointing and was stressful  too. Since i accidentally left merchandise necause of the cashback commotion and even with receipt they can't help me reimbursed what i purchased or replaced it. 
There were 4 employees and no one ask the customers if they got everything with them.

Walmart employees customer service are way better than Smith's.

Having a grocery store within walking distance of your house is a luxury that people often take for granted. Having a few of them within the same distance is a blessing that I will appreciate beyond belief. 

Smith's might not be my first choice for groceries, but I will go in from time to time to compare them to the competitor across the street and when I am too lazy to go to TJ.

I like that I can get in and out without much hassle and once in a while they have some great pantry stocking sales.

I came in on the fly to get some thin, strip steak for our Steak Pizzaiola, and the gentleman in the meat department was very helpful, in helping me locate the choice of meat that I needed! Very friendly face, mature gentlemen, great work!

I stopped by here after work to pick up a couple of things and oh my goodness!!! There was an item I needed and there was an employee in the aisle who was stocking (I won't say in what section as I don't want to embarrass him) who had such bad body odor!!!  I tried holding my breath as I looked for what I needed but the odor was too much. I honestly thought I would puke. I said to my boyfriend who was at the other end of the aisle and told him I can't get what I need cause that dude smells too bad and my boyfriend said "yeah, I know. I can smell him from here".

We went to another part of the store to get the other things I on my list but before we went to pay, I decided to look down the aisle to see if the guy was gone and he was. I started walking down the aisle and I could still smell him!!!  His odor lingered in the air! Disgusting!!!

I don't think I'll go back to this store. I'm surprised his manager or coworkers didn't say anything to him about his body odor.

Take a shower, dude! Use deodorant!

The inside definitely doesn't match the outside! I have been to this location many times in the last but was hesitant to come back because the last time I was here, the inside did match the outside.

I think they may have done some major remodeling inside because it looks amazing in here. I mean it is clean and very well organized. While I was shopping I felt at home and loved the selections they had which is what I've come to expect from a Smitty's. I haven't a reason not to shop this location in the future based upon the upgrades they have done inside. I apologize if the updates were done a long time ago. As mentioned, haven't shopped here in years. I would go out on a limb and even say this location looks better than the one I sometimes shop on Sunset and Sunset. Glad I stopped by!

I came here at 11:15pm with my husband and brother-in-law. My husband went to get a shopping cart. An employee named Sara, who claimed that she was the manager, told my husband that he couldn't have a shopping cart. Then she followed us through the store (until we reached the back of the store) and taunted him with a cart. As soon as his back was turned, she said loudly, "he doesn't have the balls to face me." Then she walked away. I followed her and said very politely, "excuse me, excuse me, ma'am." She completely ignored me and walked away, like literally through the entire store. Another cashier told her, "there's a customer you're ignoring." Sara said, "I'm not talking to that bitch."

I told her that I didn't appreciate the way she spoke to my husband and that her behavior was unprofessional. She told me to speak with the manager. I said, "I'd love to." And then she smiled a big broad smile and said, "I'M THE MANAGER." 

When we went to check out, she continued to harass my husband. When I told her I video'd her bad behavior, she offered to let us use her employee discount. Um, no thanks, crazy. 

Do yourself a favor and don't shop here unless you want unwarranted harassment from a crazy person.

the store it self very nice and staff helpful other than the pharmacist very rude moved here a year ago due to family issues and have duel homes here and in Florida as well was told that laws have changed and cannot use my dl from Florida that I need a Nevada Id I was told by DMV you cannot have two id's its ILLEAGAL!!! I travel back and forth get my scripts filled for 3mnth at a time due to traveling back an forth was told that the DEA. is not going to allow me to fill my scripts until I bring a Nevada id or the deed to my home this is being told to me verbally nothing written which is required if it is in fact a LAW that was changed in February of this year she refused to show me anything at all then question me on my sons scripts which get filled there every month due to different last names  I have never been so insulted and disrespected made to feel like I am a drug addict for taking a diet pill that I pay cash for that they refuse to fill until my doctor calls and says ok fill insurance will not pay for it I told the store manager what happened and that will be the last time I set one foot in this store she is a pharmacist not a doctor I have many of those do not need this aggravation with these people

I used to live in Henderson and thought this Smith's would be like the one by Horizon Ridge, but it totally isn't. It's smaller or - I don't know, it doesn't look as well cared for or something.  I only go here because it's close to me and sells the groceries I need.  Staff are pretty decent and the place is usually clean. I wish they had more cashiers, though, and more staff bringing in carts. 

 There's this one kid doing the bagging who is so funny- he's naturally humorous and relates to the customers well.  Good job, kid. He's going places.

None better in the valley. Every possible good thing I can think of to say about a business. We had a problem at Thanksgiving with a turkey. No hoops to jump through. Just go to the check out and tell them to give you whatever you want. It worked . We have employees and managers jumping to open new check outs the manager is a ball of fire tiny little thing that is just a pleasure to be around. SERVICE with a capital S is the theme for this Store. Congratulations to all employees at this location you are all wonderful !!!

This store from the outside looks like a dump.  It very nice inside. Been shopping there for  a while. I went in this week with my 2 little ones and mistakenly knocked over a cardboard display. The department manager gave me this crazy look. She realized I was sorry and the other gal working ran over to help so she did too. She always seems busy and not so eager to help. I love the people in the deli and the gal Stacey in the cheese/snack aisle is super friendly and very helpful. I also like the young man in diary...craig .  This gal's name is candy...soyr candy that is. The store manager patty is super nice and so are the women at the pharmacy
Friendly service and always accommodating with my students who have disabilities.  Great place to shop.

I am just not a fan of this place.  The parking lot sucks.  It's really tight and whoever designed it should be shot.  Everytime I have ever been inside, the meat/seafood department smells horrible.  There is no chance I will ever buy any fresh meat or seafood there. 

My Mom loves this store, however, so we do stop here every now and then.  She seems to find good deals - most recently I was making a pumpkin cheesecake and needed cream cheese, so she ran in and was able to find cream cheese on sale (Kroger Brand) 10 for $10. Pretty decent. 

Overall I think the store seems to be pretty old and run down, and I've seen some pretty shady characters in the parking lot.  I live less than a block from an Albertson's, and for convenience and cleanliness alone, I will pay a little bit higher prices.  Sorry, Smith's.

Every week when I need fresh produce and snacks for my meal preps, I prefer Smith's over other competing supermarket company. I never had issues with cleanliness, staff, parking, or the products they advertise. 
This review will be based on my multiple experiences I have encountered with Smith's Clicklist Pickup:

Pros: If you're short on time and already know what you plan to buy, I highly recommend to go with this stress-free system. You shop online, pay what you owe, reserve a pickup time at the Smith's store that does this service, park at their designated stall, and wait for them to load your vehicle with your groceries. Whoever came up with idea I will marry them because this is such a convenience for me and others who are limited on time. I've been timing their service and literally takes no more than 5 minutes. Granted, if all your items are available than you are out of the parking lot in no time. However, the items that may not be available will be substituted for a similar product. If you choose not to make a substitution then that item is off your cart and you don't pay for it. Their customer service is exceptional.

Cons: I do have to say that parking can be a hassle at times. You have incoming and outgoing traffic from the nearby gas station, restaurants, and stores nearby and the Clicklist Parking just so happens to land in front of all that traffic. Luckily, you have a one-hour window to pick up your groceries! 

Tips:
1) Service fee is free for your first 3 orders. On the 4th order, the service fee is $4.95.
2) Have any questions in general? Here is the website URL:
https://www.smithsfoodanddrug.com/topic/clicklist
3) You may use paper coupons but it will add more time to your pickup experience. I recommend using the digital coupons since they are automatically added to your total. Digital coupons can be found under the "Savings" tab beneath the Smith's Logo. 
4) Very Important! They do not accept cash, checks. and gift cards. Only debit and credit cards!

My first job ever was bagging groceries. It doesn't take much to get the job.. Just a little common sense and an open schedule. Kids are lacking the sense part these days!

Do not eff with me and my produce. And by "eff with my produce" I mean please respect it like you would a baby and don't smash it with heavy stuff. Every time... no matter how I send my groceries down the conveyer, the teens at this location are guaranteed to put some cans in with your bread and put your coffee on top of your bananas. I suggest you be aggressive and bag yourself if you like your food bruise free.

Also the beer selection sucks.

Very large. Not particularly impressed by the selection. The good news is that the prices are pretty good--I do think they're a little cheaper than some of the other places around. Cleanliness is so-so. So, A for price, D for selection, C for cleanliness...that's 3 stars.

This use to be the perfect place to get in and out easily. Now it's extremely busy at all hours! What changed you may ask?? Well food for less that was about a mile up the street closed in January. Which caused a huge spike in business here. If you are looking for a place that is not a Walmart and that has a good quality of food this is the right place. Prices are alittle high but meats and bakery is a great start here. Will continue to come here since I don't care to stop at the biggest store for groceries. But maybe I should choose a different hour of the day then  around dinner time.

I have an update ! 
Do not EVER pay your utilities here. The line moves like molasses. God bless the poor girl who works this area but every time I've come here to pay my power I have waited over 30 mins. It just seems like she has no clue. Some kind of disaster is always happening at that desk. I waited a few months and went back and the case is still the same. Clueless unproductivity.... seriously fuck this location it fails on all aspects.

Stopping off at the store again for fresh stuff that I can't keep for too long. 
I am looking at getting yorgurt, bread for sandwich, milk and some kind of fruit. 
I have to be good with my diet and watch my glucose, so I am trying to get fresh item to eat daily.
I know sale items starts today on Wednesday,  hope they some good deals for me to make other meals during the rest of the week.
Smiths Store is pretty easy to shop at as they are a few of the stores left that have self check out  in the store. I know VONS and Albertsons in my area has taken those lanes out. It is a pain when you only have a few item to check out and wanna go.
plus using the Smith rewards card can help on your gas pending o  your shopping dollars. more you spend of course the better your rewards at the pump will be. 
And I have to get a gift card for a gift and they have everything under the sun as for gift cards to, so even more convenient to shop at.
Logan in the Bakery went out of his way and made 2 loafs of fresh Garlic Bread for me , old school Great service never goes out of style.

I guess as far as grocery stores go, I like this one the best in Vegas...at least it's not plugged up with electric scooters and screaming idiots on the 1rst and 15th like Walmart, but don't fall for free newspaper trick by the Review Journal..they will tell you off big time of you don't want to hear their subscription sales pitch!

It may sound a bit petty but I'm annoyed with their customer service desk. They stay open until 7 and it's what the sign posted says. I pay my utilities there. Well I've gone there 3 times between 5 and 6 and it was closed. I finally decided to go across the street to Albertsons. I don't like shopping there but I have to go there to pay my bills. I used to like smiths because  my bank is there, I do my shopping and pay my bills in one store. Now I'm a little irritated. It's just bad service to close 1-2 hours early on a regular basis yet your sign states 7.

Review focused on ClickList-

Wow!! The staff in charge of ClickList here is phenomenal!! Melissa and Nicole have gone above and beyond to get me through a stressful morning that was due to my technological user error, but they treated me so kindly and were patient and insanely helpful even though it was not their issue at all! Cannot thank these ladies enough for their kindness! I go weekly to pick up my groceries each Saturday morning. It has certainly become a busy time, but they never treat you with stress or rush things. They do everything the right way, ensure eggs are in the front seat, ask where things should go- trunk or seats, SHOW you the substitutes and explain everything so well along the way. Seriously saves me so much time and stress as an expecting mother with a toddler to care for!! 

Bravo to the supervisor Melissa, and her amazing staff - highlighting Nicole especially, as she is our regular girl each week and always so friendly to me and my daughter! We appreciate your kindness and hard work!! I recommend ClickList to all my fellow mom friends. It's such a life saver!
Their are two older women that work the deli at times they always seem to be having a bad day
The prices and quality of food is just as good or better than Walmart. The digital coupons and the Smiths app provide a wealth of additional savings. The easy options for check out are amazballz.

This Smith's has gotten much better since they remodeled it.  I still perfer the Smith's up off Eastern. They seem to have a better selection on some items. But this one is closer and will contuinue to still use.

The staff in the bakery rock! Thanks for all the wonderful cakes you make for us here at Las Vegas Dissemination Company. All the employees love the cakes you bake for us:) Yay! Great cake, staff, quality and reliability! Mary Irby Las Vegas

Went to track down the Friday Freebies that are piling up on my Smith's card. Knowing that they are usually out of them or hidden in the store made me grumpy but I persevered. 
I found one item where it should be on the shelf but the other was missing. I poked around up front and found a display with the missing item! Nice that this store places some of the Friday Freebies up front. I shall try to remember that!
Good prices, and they opened a check stand just as we go in line and they do this all the time. Nice clerks and the selections are great. Oh and SALE ON Gatorade

Recently I've noticed a lot of homeless people soliciting in the Smith's shopping center recently but to have one  sleeping right in front of the entrance for over 30mins. I was going to wake him up on my way out but now days you never know with people. But overall still a good place to shop, they just need to talk to someone about the issue.
Good prices and better products. Kroger brand is tough to beat. This location is 24-hour also makes best choice to shop!

This Smith's location is just ok. It's definitely showing its age and is incredibly dated but the service and selection was decent. 

I can't say I will make this a regular grocery stop but if you live in the area you could do worse in a store.

This store is scary.  The employees block aisles in the middle of the day.  The vendors yell back and forth,  mostly the bro bro guys. Talked to Bryan today... The manager while he stared at me like a chicken, hands crossed and seemingly very tense.  I pointed this out and he stayed frozen all clenched up until I left weirede out again by this store.  Closest to my home but geez

Friendly staff!  Well worth having the member reward card for your key chain with the ticket specials offered daily.   Weekly meat specials on certain days, ask in the meat department for best days for catching awesome deals!!  

A lot of variety in all departments.  Store is always very clean and easy to navigate.

Only negatives I have found are 2 products which I haven't been able to find in stock ever here:  blue bell ice cream and boathouse chai tea latte

I usually enjoy shopping at the Smiths on west Charleston but lately it seems they are out of stock on the main items I'm going there to buy.  Example: Zevia canned soda. It was on sale for $3.99 so went to pick up a few six packs and of course the cola was out.  I went to customer service and stood in line to get a Raincheck for when it's in stock again.  I was told the truck would deliver more that night.  The next morning I went back...no Zevia cola.  I have been been back to that store numerous times over the past few weeks and no Zevia cola.  I guess I either give up or try a different Smiths store.  Why issue a raincheck if you never have the product in stock? Grrrrrrr
